channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Monolith: Real Time Recommendation System With Collisionless Embedding Table
item.description: In this paper, we present Monolith, a system tailored for online training.

item.title: Smarter, Better, Faster, Longer: A Modern Bidirectional Encoder for Fast, Memory Efficient, and Long Context Finetuning and Inference
item.description: Encoder-only transformer models such as BERT offer a great performance-size tradeoff for retrieval and classification tasks with respect to larger decoder-only models.

item.title: Semantic Operators: A Declarative Model for Rich, AI-based Analytics Over Text Data
item.description: Furthermore, we develop several novel optimizations that take advantage of the declarative nature of semantic operators to accelerate semantic filtering, clustering and join operators by up to $400\times$ while offering statistical accuracy guarantees.

item.title: CosyVoice 2: Scalable Streaming Speech Synthesis with Large Language Models
item.description: By training on a large-scale multilingual dataset, CosyVoice 2 achieves human-parity naturalness, minimal response latency, and virtually lossless synthesis quality in the streaming mode.

item.title: Autoregressive Video Generation without Vector Quantization
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach that enables autoregressive video generation with high efficiency.

item.title: Best-of-N Jailbreaking
item.description: We find that BoN Jailbreaking achieves high attack success rates (ASRs) on closed-source language models, such as 89% on GPT-4o and 78% on Claude 3. 5 Sonnet when sampling 10, 000 augmented prompts.

item.title: SLAM3R: Real-Time Dense Scene Reconstruction from Monocular RGB Videos
item.description: In this paper, we introduce SLAM3R, a novel and effective monocular RGB SLAM system for real-time and high-quality dense 3D reconstruction.

item.title: Large Concept Models: Language Modeling in a Sentence Representation Space
item.description: In this paper, we present an attempt at an architecture which operates on an explicit higher-level semantic representation, which we name a concept.

item.title: On the Measure of Intelligence
item.description: To make deliberate progress towards more intelligent and more human-like artificial systems, we need to be following an appropriate feedback signal: we need to be able to define and evaluate intelligence in a way that enables comparisons between two systems, as well as comparisons with humans.

item.title: Lyra: An Efficient and Speech-Centric Framework for Omni-Cognition
item.description: As Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) evolve, expanding beyond single-domain capabilities is essential to meet the demands for more versatile and efficient AI.

item.title: PsyDraw: A Multi-Agent Multimodal System for Mental Health Screening in Left-Behind Children
item.description: Left-behind children (LBCs), numbering over 66 million in China, face severe mental health challenges due to parental migration for work.

item.title: Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens
item.description: We introduce the Byte Latent Transformer (BLT), a new byte-level LLM architecture that, for the first time, matches tokenization-based LLM performance at scale with significant improvements in inference efficiency and robustness.

item.title: Video Seal: Open and Efficient Video Watermarking
item.description: To reduce these gaps, this paper introduces Video Seal, a comprehensive framework for neural video watermarking and a competitive open-sourced model.

item.title: Allegro: Open the Black Box of Commercial-Level Video Generation Model
item.description: Significant advancements have been made in the field of video generation, with the open-source community contributing a wealth of research papers and tools for training high-quality models.

item.title: AnySat: An Earth Observation Model for Any Resolutions, Scales, and Modalities
item.description: Geospatial models must adapt to the diversity of Earth observation data in terms of resolutions, scales, and modalities.

item.title: OpenEMMA: Open-Source Multimodal Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description: Furthermore, OpenEMMA demonstrates effectiveness, generalizability, and robustness across a variety of challenging driving scenarios, offering a more efficient and effective approach to autonomous driving.

item.title: Thinking in Space: How Multimodal Large Language Models See, Remember, and Recall Spaces
item.description: Humans possess the visual-spatial intelligence to remember spaces from sequential visual observations.

item.title: GraphWiz: An Instruction-Following Language Model for Graph Problems
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved impressive success across several fields, but their proficiency in understanding and resolving complex graph problems is less explored.

item.title: LeviTor: 3D Trajectory Oriented Image-to-Video Synthesis
item.description: The intuitive nature of drag-based interaction has led to its growing adoption for controlling object trajectories in image-to-video synthesis.

item.title: StateFlow: Enhancing LLM Task-Solving through State-Driven Workflows
item.description: In StateFlow, we distinguish between "process grounding" (via state and state transitions) and "sub-task solving" (through actions within a state), enhancing control and interpretability of the task-solving procedure.
